means: 给予…精力，能量( energize的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Acupuncture has a harmonizing and energizing effect on mind and body.
sentence.Network_cn: 针灸具有协调和激活身心机能的功效。

sentence.Network_en: a refreshing and energizing fruit drink
sentence.Network_cn: 提神并增加体能的果汁饮料

sentence.Network_en: The time required after energizing a device, before its rated output characteristics begin to apply.
sentence.Network_cn: 从设备通电到它开始提供额定输出特性之间所需的时间.

entry.tran: 使充满活力;使精力充沛
entry.def: To energize someone means to give them the enthusiasm and determination to do something.

example.ex: He helped energize and mobilize millions of people around the nation...
example.tran: 他帮助激励和动员了全国数百万人。

example.ex: I am completely energized and feeling terrific.
example.tran: 我充满了活力，感觉非常好。

means.word_mean: 1. the activity of causing to have energy and be active

sentences.sentence: "the complex civilization of which Rome was the kinetic center"- H.O.Taylor

auth_sentence.content: More than making ends meet, work is physically and mentally energizing for many people.
auth_sentence.res_content: More than making ends meet, work is physically and mentally energizing for many people.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: More than making ends meet, work is physically and mentally energizing for many people.

auth_sentence.content: But there were also some important things the president missed, but which are vital to energizing American innovation.
auth_sentence.res_content: But there were also some important things the president missed, but which are vital to energizing American innovation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But there were also some important things the president missed, but which are vital to energizing American innovation.

auth_sentence.content: "That would be a wonderful, energizing and positive moment to feel like we the people are in charge, " he said.
